metadata.title: CVE-2023-6039 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in lan78xx_disconnect indrivers/net/usb/lan78xx.c in the network sub-component, net/usb/lan78xx inthe Linux Kernel. This flaw allows a local attacker to crash the systemwhen the LAN78XX USB device detaches.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6039` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-94-generic - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-5.15.0-94-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-94-generic - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-94-generic-64k - 5.15.0-94.104
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-39-generic - 6.2.0-39.40~22.04.1
linux-image-6.2.0-39-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-39.40~22.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-94.104').
